  • 2004-08-15 13:59:32

    login

    Win Xp
    and no admin is not in the config file the user for the db is in config.
    There are no settings for admin in the config file.
    A admin superuser or god account has 100% control of the application from db to functions.
    With a admin option in a application useing a db i have never seen a admin account with out being in the db someplace. Just as if you open the user table in the database for atutor you will see users with there passwords. Some place in order for the db to recognize a superuser god or admin account. It has to call the application from some point. As this application uses a db it should be calling from a storage point as such in this case the db. But no where can i see it to help identify why no login for the admin is available. PHP only calles on functions when attacthed to a db it usually calls from the db for the proper information to allow the function to work

  • 2004-08-15 14:41:21

    Your system?

    You could help us solve this problem for others if we knew what Webserver and version of PHP you have running. Different webservers, and their versions, and different versions of php present different issues. WinXP installations are commonly troublesome, if installed with IIS and/or PHP5.

    If you have access to a Linux/Unix based system with Apache and PHP 4.3+ running, this is a more optimal setup.
